ANU.name: Helen Bromhead
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
expertise: Linguistic Structures Incl. Grammar Phonology Lexicon Semantics
interest: Semantics, Pragmatics, Syntax, Anthropological Linguistics, History of English, Australian English, Landscape Categorisation, Environmental Discourse
ANU.biography: Helen Bromhead is an Honorary Lecturer in the School of Literature, Languages, and Linguistics. She is the author of Landscape and culture: Cross-linguistic perspectives (2018, John Benjamins) and The reign of truth and faith: Epistemic expressions in 16th and 17th century English (2009, Mouton de Gruyter).

publication.title: Meaning
publication.source: Lifeand Culture: In Conversation with Anna Wierzbicka, ANU Press, Canberra

publication.title: The semantics of standing water places in English, French, and Pitjantjatjara/Yankunytjatjara
publication.source: in Zhengdao Ye (ed.), The Semantics of Nouns, Oxford University Press, United Kingdom, pp. 180-203pp

publication.title: Ethnogeographical categories in English and Pitjantjatjara/Yankunytjatjara
The Bush in Australian English
publication.source: Australian Journal of Linguistics, vol. 31, no. 4, pp. 445-471

publication.title: The Reign of Truth and Faith: Epistemic Expressions in 16th and 17th Century English
